title: Riot's dictator like suspension of me

replies.body:
>yes and we told you specifically we dont want this name in our game and that you'd be suspended if you chose it again

Seems pretty straightforward to me. I'm not exactly sure why this is such a big deal. Riot's house = Riot's rules. You might think they're silly, but that doesn't mean you can just ignore them.

So, you were told that it was against the rules. They gave you a chance **absolutely free** to pick a different name.

You chose instead to use a name you **knew** violated the rules.

Yes, your suspension is deserved. Maybe you should reread the ToU - Riot has sole authority to determine if your name is offensive or not. They generally do so based on reports from the community, and they tend not to release numbers of reports to you when it is changed.

Yeah I was not told. I logged in, saw a message explaining my comms had been toxic in game with a name change request attached so I immediately changed it back to my name for the past 4 years before I read went to my email and saw the message.

So, you didn't think about *why* your name was being changed?

You didn't ask Support why your name was being changed?

You just assumed your old name had no problems and that the change was for no reason whatsoever?

----
Further, Skeletor makes clear they sent a message to you it was not okay when they force-changed it. I'm not sure if this went to your email, or was in client, or support, or somewhere else - but honestly it's on you as it's illogical to think "hmm, Riot's making me change my name because there was no problem with the old one!"

I literally did think why and ask support why in a ticket. They replied with a statement saying I was banned for changing it back and not why it was unacceptable. It's just a different ticket than the live chats that i copy pasted. The message stating my name was offensive went to my email. The only message i received in game stated that my communication in game had been toxic. Nothing to do with a name being offensive. I immediately changed it back to Paul walkers car as soon as I was forced to change before going to my email. And yes after 4 years of having this name i thought it was a mistake. My point is Riot is dictator like and you even helped me point by quoting the ToS. Riot has sole discretion. I honestly did not even know this could be viewed as offensive and tried to be reasonable but they ban me without an explanation. They can't explain their reasoning behind banning me. I've talked to 3 different supports and all of them sidestep the question/ are unable to give me a legit answer.

So, you got an email saying your name was offensive, yet you still chose to change it back, and you're now surprised that you're being further punished for it.

This does not make any sense. You were told that Riot used their power of sole determination and said that your name was offensive. There is no arguing that - Riot has the right to deem your name offensive and prohibit you from using it.
So you can't read that I stated I did not see the email until after I had changed it. Good to know.

The email would've sent immediately when they applied the force-change.

You not reading your email, and especially not even checking it when you saw the force name change, is not their fault.

Yes I shouldve been banned according to their Terms of Use. Considering that I had the name for 4 years, I know someone IRL who has done the same exact thing as me without a ban and his name has c0ck in it so I didnt know it was bannable, and the fact that it is only disputably offensive to some, and no previous suspensions in 7 years not count for anything?

You were not banned simply because you were unaware your name was offensive.

You were banned because after you were made aware of it (whether you checked your email or not is not Riot's problem) and still chose to return to the name you were made aware was offensive.

Yes Riot is dictator like, this is their game and they are allowed to be. They said your name was offensive and the TOS says if they find your name offensive you have to change it or GTFO. You chose to GTFO.

While i personally dont care about the name, and i dont see why anyone would, its not like their request wasnt without merit. They had a legitimate reason for it. And you decided to play the "nope gunna argue" game. Had you just asked for the explanation, gotten it, then proceeded to not be a dick and agree to change it, you might have been given the benefit of the doubt after explaining yourself.

The way I see it there are two options here.

1. You had that name before the car crash.  If this was the case your name physically couldn't be a reference to the crash, and accusing you of having a name as a reference to said crash would be the same as accusing you of time travel.

2. You only had that name after the crash.  If this was the case your name was definitely a reference to the crash, and can easily be seen as offensive.

What is and what is not offensive is very relative, and stuff like this really needs to take every bit of context into account.  That said, the actions you chose to take in dealing with this situation did not help you in the slightest.  Ultimately it doesn't matter what is right or what is logically consistent, all that matters is what the people with the power think, and you didn't really make your case in a way that would allow them to easily side with you.

I'm not too familiar with what this case is about, but if option one is the case you should get your name back.  I have no power here, so that's just my opinion.

> Skeletor tried to seem like a support but really is just a sjw baby in disguise

Honestly, with you saying shit like this I would be willing to side with Skeletor on this one, even if he is accusing you of time travel.  Don't be an asshole.
Yeah I never disrespected anyone until they banned my account without warning.

Yeah, showing your true colors is fun, isn't it?

So what's the answer here?  Is option 1 correct, or is option 2?

Lmao yeah you know my true colors and how I act as a person. The fact that I survived 7 years on league without punishment until this is fact enough to prove im not toxic.  You're wrong for assuming anything and I couldn't possibly care less about your opinion.

Did you have that name before the car crash?

Now please, answer the question so we know which side to take on this issue.
Ah yes i do see the first and only time now When u asked if its option one or two. My mistake. Either way I answered your question and you didn't even have a response to it soooo.....

I don't remember isn't a usable answer.  If you want any sort of sympathy or support you're going to have to actually look up when you started playing League.  Yes it was a long time ago, but if you can't prove that you had the name before the car crash then you have no case here, and might as well move on.  This is the only thing that matters right now, because if you had the name before the crash there is no physical way your name should have been punishable.

I'm all for taking people in power down a notch when they do something without the facts, but we actually need the facts first.  Go track the date down, we'll be here waiting.
